title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Interoperability
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Interoperability 

of the Rail System) (Designated Bodies) (Fees) Regulations 2021.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european union (interoperability rail system) (designated bodies) (fees) regulation 2021

title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and
heading: In these Regulations —
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations — 

“designated body” means a body designated by the safety authority under 
Regulation 16(3) of the European Union (Interoperability of the Rail System) 
Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 477 of 2020) to carry out the verification procedure 
in respect of national rules; 

“safety authority” means Commission for Railway Regulation.
text_norm: 2 regulation -- designated body mean body designated safety authority regulation 16(3) european union (interoperability rail system) regulation 2020 (s.i no 477 2020) carry verification procedure respect national rule safety authority mean commission railway regulation

title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and
heading: 3. The safety authority shall charge a body, applying to it to be designated
text_raw:
3. The safety authority shall charge a body, applying to it to be designated 
as a designated body, in respect of assessing the application, a fee of €15,000 
covering the first 20 days of assessment of the application and, thereafter, a daily 
fee of €750 for each subsequent day or part thereof of assessment.
text_norm: 3 safety authority shall charge body applying designated designated body respect assessing application fee eur15 000 covering first 20 day assessment application thereafter daily fee eur750 subsequent day part thereof assessment

title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and
heading: 4. The safety authority shall charge a designated body a fee of €750 for each
text_raw:
4. The safety authority shall charge a designated body a fee of €750 for each 
day in respect of any annual surveillance activity it undertakes on the designated 
body.
text_norm: 4 safety authority shall charge designated body fee eur750 day respect annual surveillance activity undertakes designated body

title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and
heading: 5. The fees paid under these Regulations shall be paid to the safety authority
text_raw:
5. The fees paid under these Regulations shall be paid to the safety authority 
in such manner as it may direct, accrue to the safety authority and be applied for 
the purpose of meeting expenses properly incurred by the safety authority in the 
discharge of its functions. 

1 OJ No. L138, 26.05.2016, p.44 
2 OJ No. L165, 27.05.2020, p.27 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 16th April, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [176] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

15 April, 2021. 

EAMON RYAN,

title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The purpose of these Regulations is to support the implementation of Council 
Directive (EU) 2016/797 on the interoperability of the rail system which was 
transposed under the European Union (Interoperability of the Rail System) 
Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 477 of 2020). Under Regulation 16(3) of S.I. No 
477 of 2020, the Commission for Railway Regulation has the function to 
designate bodies responsible for carrying out conformity assessment activities in 
respect of national rules. These Regulations set the fee payable to the 
Commission for the task of assessing applications from bodies seeking to be 
designated as designated bodies in respect of national rules and also the fee 
payable for annual surveillance of designated bodies by the Commission. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [176] 5
